summary: This document is an email chain from June 2020 between federal prosecutors (USANYS) and FBI agents discussing an update on the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation. It includes a forwarded news article about Maxwell winning a delay in a civil lawsuit deposition due to the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the forwarded news article; described as the alleged madam of Jeffrey Epstein who won a delay in a civil lawsuit deposition due to the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned in the forwarded news article as the financier whose alleged nefarious activities involved Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Debra Freeman
persons.context: The judge who ruled to delay Ghislaine Maxwell's deposition in the civil lawsuit.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Maxwell's attorney who asked the federal judge to stay Maxwell's deposition, citing the ongoing criminal investigation by the SDNY.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as the alleged madam of Epstein, involved in his alleged nefarious activities.
Laura Menninger is identified as Maxwell's lawyer who filed the request to delay her deposition.

events.title: Fox News reports on Maxwell's deposition delay
events.description: Fox News reports that Ghislaine Maxwell won a request to delay questioning in a civil lawsuit due to concerns her testimony could incriminate her in a potential future criminal case.

events.title: Previous conversation referenced
events.description: An FBI agent asks if anything has changed since a conversation on May 11, indicating a prior coordination point.

keyFacts: The email chain shows coordination between federal prosecutors (USANYS) and FBI agents regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation in June 2020.
A forwarded news article from May 23, 2020, reports that Magistrate Judge Debra Freeman granted Ghislaine Maxwell's request to delay her deposition in a civil lawsuit.
The delay was sought by Maxwell's lawyer, Laura Menninger, on grounds that testimony could incriminate Maxwell in the ongoing SDNY criminal investigation into Epstein co-conspirators.

The FBI agent's question ('has anything changed since our May 11 conversation?') and reference to 'waiting for GJ to begin' suggests the criminal investigation was active and a grand jury (GJ) was anticipated.
The document indicates the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York had publicly announced an ongoing criminal investigation into alleged Epstein co-conspirators.
